concept.title: Referencing Sensitive Values in Files
concept.shortdesc: For increased security you can store sensitive information, such as a password, in separate files and reference the files in the configuration file, $SDC_CONF/sdc.properties, as follows: ${file("<filename>")}.

conbody.p: Data Collector configuration filestoring passwords and other sensitive valuespasswordsstoring in filesYou can store a single piece of information in a file. When starts, it checks the reference files for information. By default, expects the SMTP password and keystore password to be stored in files.

To store and reference sensitive information:
Create a text file for each configuration value that you want to safeguard.
Include only one configuration value in each file.
You can store any configuration value in a separate file, but do not include more than one configuration value in a file.
Save the file in the configuration directory, $SDC_CONF.
In the configuration file, $SDC_CONF/sdc.properties, set the relevant value to the appropriate file name. Use the required syntax as follows:${file("<filename>")}
